hi BigNose just wanting to say, still a fan of this mod and really like the changes. Very nice to have different modes set by action groups now (I know that was done a while ago, been meaning to comment on it) and they function very reliably now. no more mashing o and p!

My latest fav use of this mod is to put two red nav lights on the back of rovers, then put the toggle light action in the brakes action group. When you hit the brakes the lights come on and then go off as soon as you stop braking. yay!

I already do that, but what do you do when your ship has four fronts depending on the circumstances.

What I mean is the ship I made changes it's forward direction based on 4 action groups. I have a semi-elaborate system where my vtol engines change direction (or not) depending on what I press. I'm also forced to use the only similar light from b9 to show me which direction the ship will move when throttled up and I can do that because each action group turns ON one light and turns OFF the other three. I still have to look at my cockpits to figure out what's port and what's starboard, which is a little difficult in the dark. I'm pretty sure it's easy to do, so why not? Other mods do it, and doing what other mods do will make your mod cool in the eyes of other mods. And you don't want your mod to be a loser.... I hope I've belabored the point

Of course this is possible, but then I need to implement ALL of the following actions at once:

ON

TOGGLE

OFF

Flash ON

Flash TOGGLE

Flash OFF

Int ON

Int TOGGLE

Int OFF

I think most people are happy with one key for ON/OFF, putting these 6 extra actions in is kinda over-engineered, don't you think?

At least you have to admit, a ship with four fronts is a rare special case!

Hi Edward,

actually, there is already an amber/yellow light made by Deadweasel. I will integrate it in the next release.

Regarding stock balancing, those problems are known. They weigh 10kg at the moment, because I missed a 0 in the config, it should be 1kg. Also, as you mentioned, power consumption is maybe still a bit high.

I will not however, put the lights in any action groups by default. It's too risky for one to forget about it, and then they wonder why the beacons don't flash anymore when you switch on your lights for docking illumination, etc.

Thank you for pointing out those things, though.

I should really release an update, I think I will do that today, let me just do some more testing.

BigNose

I LOVE this mod! It's one of the final touches I always put on all my spacecraft. And thank you for not including them in the "Lights" group. I use a special action group that toggles the lights through their modes and I use the same setting/action group for every vessel. The "Lights" group is fine for landing lights and headlights on rovers and whatnot, but I don't want that control to mess around with my Aviation Lights settings.

I should really release an update, I think I will do that today, let me just do some more testing.

I will be downloading as soon as you do. Seriously, this is a truly excellent addition to the game. Thank you for making it.

I too use the B9 lights for status indicating which direction my tugs engines are operating in. I use the B9 lights because I can setup action group to positively tell me which side is activated that I can't do with a toggle control. For example, Press 1 and stern lights and engines go OFF and forward lights and engines go ON. Press 2 and forward lights and engines go OFF, and stern lights and engines go ON. With a toggle if I were to press 1 twice the lights would be off but the engines would still be active.
